Author: Academic
quality_other: The Amazon reviews polarity dataset is constructed by taking review score 1 and 2 as negative, and 4 and 5 as positive. Samples of score 3 is ignored. Each class has 1,800,000 training samples and 200,000 testing samples.

Author: Academic
quality_other: Following previous work on polarity classification, we consider only highly polarized reviews. A negative review has a score ≤ 4 out of 10, and a positive review has a score ≥ 7 out of 10. Neutral reviews are not included in the dataset.

Author: Academic
quality_other: seems OK, would need to select by strong polarity starts; might still contain weird reviews; probably also use review length; probably negative <= 3, positive == 5
